# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = []
    current_line = []

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, join(current_line, " "))
            current_line = [word]
        else
            push!(current_line, word)
        end
    end

    push!(lines, join(current_line, " "))
    lines
end

# Example
wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Maecenas bibendum laoreet ante vitae facilisis.")
```

This `wrap_string` function takes a string as its first argument and an optional `text_width` as its second argument. It splits the string into words, maintains a current line with words and adds a new line when the text width is exceeded, and finally returns an array of lines.
